name: FetchFolderFileCount
description:
Get the count of all files in a folder.

This tool checks and returns the total number of files present in a specified folder. Use this when you need to know how many files are contained within a folder on the file system.

parameters.name: file_system_uuid
parameters.description: A UUID string that uniquely identifies the file system for which you want to get the file count.

value_schema.description: A UUID string identifying this file system.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID to access the project for counting files. Obtain via /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: file_system_request_body
parameters.description: JSON object containing details like 'id', 'path', 'depth', 'type', and more to specify folder criteria.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A UUID string identifying this file system.

value_schema.description: A UUID string identifying this file system.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
